activities:
Terex may process certain EEA (European Economic Area) and/or Swiss personal
information including on-line, off-line, and manually processed data regarding:

1. customers, business partners, prospects, independent contractors, and suppliers:
- to help customers and business partners complete a transaction or order
- to deliver products/services
- to provide customers and business partners with information and services
- to bill for purchased products/services
- to provide ongoing service and support
- to contact customers and business partners to complete surveys that are used
for marketing and quality assurance
- to facilitate communication
- to evaluate creditworthiness of customers and suppliers
- for due diligence purposes and investigations
- for immigration purposes
- for contractor contributions to projects

2. human resources data (such as data of employees) and candidates for
employment:
- to implement compensation and benefit programs
- for employee development planning and review
- for performance appraisal
- for training purposes
- for administration of business travel expenses
- for administration of access to Terex facilities and computer networks
- to maintain internal employee directories
- to consider candidates for employment opportunities within Terex
- to help Terex personnel better understand the needs and interests of business
partners and customers
- for payment purposes
- for team audits
- for document management and team collaboration
- for expatriate management
- for workforce planning
- for claims management and investigations
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
orgverification: In-house; support by external law firm
recoursemech: EU data protection authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
